Participants.evidence: The clinical data of 56 patients who underwent surgery at the Department of Neurosurgery, First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

Intervention.evidence: All patients underwent skull base tumor resection assisted by intraoperative microvascular Doppler (MVD).

Objective.evidence: Objective: To investigate the role of Doppler microvascular ultrasound (MVD) in skull base surgery for the intraoperative assessment and protection of arterial blood flow.

Number_Randomised.evidence: The clinical data of 56 patients who underwent surgery at the Department of Neurosurgery, First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University between September 2017 and June 2024

Number_Analysed.evidence: No intraoperative vascular injuries were observed among the 56 patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: No intraoperative vascular injuries were observed among the 56 patients, confirmed by intraoperative Doppler monitoring and postoperative imaging.

Harms.evidence: No intraoperative vascular injuries were observed among the 56 patients, confirmed by intraoperative Doppler monitoring and postoperative imaging.
